Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for satellite communication needs, including bandwidth, latency, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Orbital.
Design the network architecture for Azure Orbital, including ground station integration, satellite uplink/downlink paths, and connectivity to Azure services.
Secure necessary regulatory approvals and authorizations for satellite communication, including spectrum licensing and compliance with local laws.
Set up Azure Orbital resources in the Azure portal, including ground station access and satellite configuration.
Set up virtual networks, VPN gateways, and ExpressRoute connections to ensure secure and reliable communication between Azure Orbital and other Azure services.
Apply security best practices, including encryption for data in transit, access control policies, and integration with Azure Sentinel for threat detection.
Perform thorough testing of satellite communication, including uplink/downlink performance, latency measurements, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to track satellite communication performance and detect issues.
Create detailed documentation of the Azure Orbital setup, including network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Orbital networking components.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Ensure proper network connectivity between Azure Orbital ground stations and the Azure cloud. Validate the configuration of virtual networks and gateways.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor network traffic between Azure Orbital ground stations and Azure cloud resources. Identify and resolve anomalies.
Ensure VPN configurations are correctly set up for secure communication between Azure Orbital ground stations and Azure cloud resources. Test VPN failover mechanisms.
Conduct regular audits of network security configurations, including firewalls, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and encryption protocols.
Simulate failover scenarios to ensure redundancy and high availability of network connections between Azure Orbital ground stations and Azure cloud resources.
Review and update network configurations to align with changes in Azure Orbital architecture or security requirements.
Regularly back up network configurations, including VPN settings, firewall rules, and routing tables, to ensure quick recovery in case of issues.
Analyze network performance metrics and implement optimizations to improve latency, throughput, and reliability of Azure Orbital connections.
Conduct drills to prepare the team for potential network outages or security incidents affecting Azure Orbital connections.
Evaluate the performance of Azure Orbital network connections against SLA metrics. Address any deviations or issues with the service provider.
